file_name: gentechholdingsinc_20190808_1-a_ex1a-6 mat ctrct_11776814_ex1a-6 mat ctrct_distributor agreement.pdf

perturbation.original_text: Company desires to appoint Distributor as its exclusive distributor of the Products to all Clients that Distributor introduce, and upon confirmed the first order, this client come to be exclusive of Distributor, every new customer introduced by Distributor, must be approved by the company prior to any sale. After official approval from the Company, the customer introduced by Distributor, will appear on an official list in this contract, and will only be met by the Distributor and will follow the rules of this agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Company desires to appoint Distributor as its exclusive distributor of the Products to all Clients that Distributor introduce, and upon confirmed the first order, this client come to be exclusive of Distributor, every new purchaser introduced by Distributor, must be approved by the company prior to any sale. After official approval from the Company, the customer introduced by Distributor, will appear on an official list in this contract, and will only be met by the Distributor and will follow the rules of this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Client' and 'purchaser' are used interchangeably without clear definition. This creates ambiguity as to whether the approval process applies to all new purchasers or only specific 'Clients', leading to uncertainty in the Distributor's obligations and potential disputes over customer acquisition.

perturbation.original_text: (a) Exclusive Appointment. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Distributor Agreement, Company hereby appoints and grants Distributor the exclusive right to sell and distribute the Products to customers that Distributor introduce and confirmed by Company, (in all territory of United State of America (USA) and to render other services as a distributor for Company as set forth herein. Distributor shall limit its activities with respect to the Products to Customers located within the Territory and refrain from selling or otherwise transferring, directly or indirectly, the Products to any person outside the Territory, without the express written consent of Company. Company shall not sell or otherwise supply, directly or indirectly, the Products to any Distributor’s Customer’s, except by sale through the Distributor. The Company shall not contact any of Distributor’s Customer’s for any reason, without the prior written approval of Distributor.
perturbation.changed_text: (a) Exclusive Appointment. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Distributor Agreement, Company hereby appoints and grants Distributor the exclusive right to sell and distribute the Products to consumers that Distributor introduce and confirmed by Company, (in all territory of United State of America (USA) and to render other services as a distributor for Company as set forth herein. Distributor shall limit its activities with respect to the Products to Customers located within the Territory and refrain from selling or otherwise transferring, directly or indirectly, the Products to any person outside the Territory, without the express written consent of Company. Company shall not sell or otherwise supply, directly or indirectly, the Products to any Distributor’s Customer’s, except by sale through the Distributor. The Company shall not contact any of Distributor’s Customer’s for any reason, without the prior written approval of Distributor.
perturbation.explanation: The document uses the terms 'customers' and 'consumers' interchangeably. This creates a contradiction as customers are usually intended to mean wholesalers and retailers that are purchasing with the intent of resale. 'Consumers' are the end-users of the product. There is no specification of what these terms mean. The lack of distinction between these categories introduces uncertainty regarding the scope of the exclusive distribution rights and potential restrictions on the Distributor's sales channels.

perturbation.original_text: (e) Payment. Upon Customer’s acceptance of any order, Distributor shall submit to Customer via wire transfer at least Twenty-Five Percent (25%) of the total order price. Distributor shall submit to Customer via wire transfer the remaining balance upon receipt Packing List and Bill of landing documents, from origin in Brazil Farm.
perturbation.changed_text: (e) Payment. Upon Client’s acceptance of any order, Distributor shall submit to purchaser via wire transfer at least Twenty-Five Percent (25%) of the total order price. Distributor shall submit to Customer via wire transfer the remaining balance upon receipt Packing List and Bill of landing documents, from origin in Brazil Farm.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Customer', 'Client', and 'purchaser' are used seemingly interchangeably, but they relate to distinct entities within the sales process. A client might be the overarching entity establishing the relationship, the purchaser is completing the transaction, and the customer is being used to refer to the business relationship within the sales channel. Since the contract requires the distributor to wire transfer funds to these entities, there should be a distinction between which is being used.
